newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila SEC sets guidelines on IPO distribution.
newsitem.headline: Manila SEC sets guidelines on IPO distribution.

text.p: The Philippine Securities and Exchange Commission set new guidelines on Monday to ensure the wide distribution of initial public share offerings.
In a memorandum, SEC Chairman Perfecto Yasay said brokers must apply to the underwriters for new shares on behalf of their clients.
The brokers must then sell all shares in a "hot" issue, defined as one which trades at a premium to its public offer price on the grey market ahead of its formal stock market listing.
Brokers may not buy any of the shares for their own account for a high-demand issue, Yasay said.
In case of a "cold" issue, Yasay said brokers must not return unsold shares to the underwriter but must purchase the shares for their own account.
A cold issue is one that trades below its IPO price on the grey market.
